thread.title: Man urinates on Colchester coats for homeless
thread.title_full: Man urinates on Colchester coats for homeless

title: Man urinates on Colchester coats for homeless
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Man urinates on Colchester coats for homeless 21 February 2017 Last updated at 16:37 GMT 
Charity workers in Colchester have had to throw away six coats intended for homeless people after they were urinated on by an unknown man. 
The coats were hanging on a rail outside the Essex town's main library, where they were available to take. 
Fay Sibley, who runs the "coat exchange," said: "One act of complete silliness won't stop us from continuing to do what we've been doing." 
Volunteers gave the area around the rack a deep cleanse and the service resumed.
